aors.controller
Class AbstractSimulator

java.lang.Object
  aors.controller.AbstractSimulator
All Implemented Interfaces:
AgentSimulatorListener, java.util.EventListener
public abstract class AbstractSimulator
extends java.lang.Object
implements AgentSimulatorListener

AbstractSimulator

Comments: This implements Runnable in order to run as a separate thread. It implements EventSimulatorListener to listen for events generated by the EnvironmentSimulator. This events are added to AbstractSimulator list of events. Following the same principle it implements the AgentSubjectListener to listen for all ActionEvents that are generated by a AgentSubject

Since:
May 23, 2008

createEnvironment

protected abstract void createEnvironment()
Usage: it is implemented in the main class of each simulation Comments: an EnvironmentSImulator must be created It is singleton (only one instance in the whole system).

createAgentSubjects

protected abstract void createAgentSubjects()
Usage: it is implemented in the main class of each simulation Comments: All AgentSubject instances are created: - initial state of each agent is set - internal events (periodic events & reminder events) are created - for each instance is created an internal AgentSimulator (internal processor). Notice that when an agent is to be run distributed this method must create a facet for the AgentSubject running remotely

createInitialEvents

protected abstract void createInitialEvents()
Usage: it must be implemented in the main class of each simulation Comments: ExogenousEvents are created if there are any. Events are created based on the InitialState element from the AOR description file. All these events are added to SimulationEngine.events

executeInitializeRules

protected abstract void executeInitializeRules()
Usage: it must be implemented in the main class of each simulation Comments: If there are InitializeRules, then the init/runs in this method

pauseSimulation

public void pauseSimulation(boolean pauseState)
Pause/continue simulation simulation. The simulation will interrupt before executing the next step or will continue.

Parameters:
pauseState - - true to pause, false to continue

setSingleStepMode

public void setSingleStepMode(boolean mode)
Sets single step mode for the simulator. If set to true, the simulation will run in single-step mode. Client needs to run continueSimulation for executing the next step.

Parameters:
mode - true for single-step mode, false for continuous

isSingleStepMode

public boolean isSingleStepMode()
Returns true if simulation runs in SingleStep mode, otherwise false.

Returns:

stopSimulation

public void stopSimulation()
Stops the simulation by setting stop variable to true which is examined in main loop. Also each running AgentSimulator is notified so that it maybe can finish its execution.

autoMultiThreading - The autoMultiThreading to set.
